comment: She did not respond to emails very well, but her grading criteria were pretty clear so I did not have to email her a lot. There is something to do every week. Do not wait until the last minute to watch all of your field experience videos, because she does not post enough to reach 15 hours, so you will have to look some videos up on YouTube for it.

i took this class online and theres something do everyweek. if you do any of the assignments wrong she tells you how to fix it and lets you turn it in again. there were two group projects and they were really easy

The instructions and videos for the assignments are vague/unhelpful, but that does allow some flexibility in how you would like to present it. There were two group projects and four discussion posts, along with a few other assignments here and there. Feedback was fine. You probably won't fail as long as you actually try

Dr. Gray doesn't give clear directions for assignments, then she asked that you refer to the syllabus when you ask questions. She shows favoritism to some students, but she makes it clear when she doesn't like you. Dr. Gray contradicts herself and is dishonest. Please make sure that you have everything in writing. Please avoid taking her class.

Almost made me want to change my major!  I had an A going into the last week of class, and my collaborating teacher sent my evaluation in late to Prof. Gray and she wouldn't accept it..ultimately causing me to fail the class!  Which in turn kept me from getting into the education program!  And, she could have cared less.  Avoid her at all cost!!!
Pretty easy class if you show up and put in an hour worth of work a week. You pretty much teach the class. No tests, one paper, about 5 short group presentations. Great class.

Good teacher.  She facilitates her students learning. For my class, she did not teach new material.  The students taught the class by outlining the textbook chapters and presenting to the class.  It was a fun experience.  Major point, multiple-choice tests could have tainted this experience, but this creative teacher allowed open book test. Great!
